subject: A free 'as time permits' offer
author: Fiona Broome
full_text:
Hi,

If voices are giving you full names (or really unusual given names) and you have a likely location for them (a location on planet Earth, that is), I'm willing to do a few quick checks to see if they have an actual history.

I probably won't be able to find John Smith in New York City, without more information.

However, I did once locate the correct John & Mary Murphy in 1880s Boston, Massachusetts.  (I found their burial records, though their graves were unmarked, and the burial info led to census records, etc.)

Anyway, if your voice has a fairly distinctive name (given name + surname) and a related location, let me know.  (The order of importances:  Full name, then location, and then -- way down the list -- the era/year.  I cannot work with just name + year; I must have a likely location.)

I'm happy to do some quick (and free) research, as time permits, to confirm whether (or not) those people actually exist in historical records.

I think it would be very cool to show that these names are real, and what they're saying fits their histories in our world.  

(I'm qualifying that -- saying "in our world" -- because I think many voices and "ghosts" are actually alive and well, but in their own parallel/alternate worlds.)

Send serious inquiries to: fiona -at- hollowhill.com

Cheerfully,
Fiona
